citation.article-title: Complete oxidation of toluene under strictly anoxic conditions by a new sulfate-reducing bacterium.

p.s: Description of Desulfobacula toluolica sp. nov.
Desulfobacula toluolica (tol.u.o' li.ca. L. adj. toluolica, pertaining to toluene)
Cells are 1.2 to 1.4 μm in diameter and 1.2 to 2.0 μm in length.
NaCl, MgCl2, and vitamins are required for growth.

Toluene, benzaldehyde, benzoate, phenylacetate, p-cresol, p-hydroxybenzaldehyde, p-hydroxybenzoate, glutarate, pyruvate, succinate, fumarate, malate, butyrate, ethanol, 1-propanol, and 1-butanol serve as electron donors and carbon sources.
Benzyl alcohol, o-, mp-, and p-methylbenzoate, o- and m-cresol, lactate, and H2 are not utilized.
The optimum pH is 7.0 to 7.1; the optimum temperature is 28°C.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 42 mol% (by thermal denaturation).
Habitat is anoxic marine sediment rich in organic compounds.
The strain is deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH under number 7467.
